title: Is orchestra a collective noun? Thus, is it “the orchestra plays beautifully” or “the orchestra play beautifully”? - Quora

response.answer_text: An orchestra is the same as a team or a business. It is a single entity made up of individual people. The single entity should be referred to in the singular, hence “ the orchestra plays beautifully.” Interestingly, however, if you were to single out, say, the three cellists for particular praise, you would use the plural: “the cellists play beautifully.”

Question: Is orchestra a collective noun? Thus, is it “the orchestra plays beautifully” or “the orchestra play beautifully”? An orchestra is a group (collective) of instrumentalists, but performs its role as one (single) unit. Therefore, “the orchestra plays beautifully” is the correct term
